name: chainhook
description: Reorg-aware indexing engine for the Stacks & Bitcoin blockchains

repo.name: chainhook
repo.description: Extract transactions from Stacks and Bitcoin and build event driven re-org resistant indexers and databases.

readme.summary: Well-structured README with excellent installation options and detailed predicate examples, but lacks a complete quick-start tutorial and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section and the quick-start example is incomplete (cuts off mid-configuration at 'Ignore any block prior to given block: "st')

injection_risks.description: Potential for log injection via user-controlled data in slog::info! macro

critical_findings: Potential for log injection via user-controlled data
Lack of validation on BlockHeader input
security.summary: The code has some security concerns related to input validation and error exposure, but no critical vulnerabilities were found.

common_complaints: Deep reorganization handling limitation (6 blocks vs hundreds)
sentiment.summary: Single open issue reporting a critical blockchain handling bug with limited community engagement (1 comment) and no visible maintainer response, suggesting potential maintenance concerns.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and encouraging to new contributors. Technical depth is strong, and there's a good balance of detail without overwhelming the reader.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-19)
88 open issues with no recent activity
No closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests stale release cycle
maintenance.summary: The package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp, indicating possible data inconsistency or a project that was briefly touched but is otherwise unmaintained.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears complete, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks troubleshooting information and could benefit from more concise quick start instructions.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, which could indicate a lack of active development.
A high number of open issues (87) suggests there may be unresolved problems or bugs.
Community: stacks deep re-orgs are not handled properly
Security: Potential for log injection via user-controlled data
Security: Lack of validation on BlockHeader input
highlights: Recent merged PRs (12 in the past six months) show that some contributions are being accepted and integrated.
Active contributors (10 in the past six months) indicate a community or group of people interested in maintaining the package.
